subject: Technology
title: The Space Shuttle Era
description: Learn The Space Shuttle Era in one minute.

hook.text: NASA promised a reusable spacecraft that would make space travel routine and affordable. It was neither.

buildup.text: The Space Shuttle first flew in 1981. It could carry crew and cargo to orbit and glide back to land.

discovery.text: Over 30 years, shuttles launched satellites, built the space station, and carried 355 people to orbit.

twist.text: Two shuttle disasters, Challenger and Columbia, killed 14 astronauts and shook public confidence.

climax.text: Each shuttle launch cost $1.5 billion. The dream of cheap, routine spaceflight remained unfulfilled.

punchline.text: The Shuttle flew often but never became the bus to space NASA promised.

quiz.question: What was the Space Shuttle's biggest unfulfilled promise?
options: Making space travel cheap and routine
